Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments, with 1888,0601.159) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip, glaze fired red-brown; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streakily below; band of lotus buds in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; top of rim glazed; exterior: band of single dots at rim above frieze of Zs between pairs of lines; below, part of elaborate rosette and painted inscription.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 202)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1986) (phase 2)
